Investment analyst Emma Wall warned investors not to let strong gains in stocks like Tesla and Apple allow them to get overexposed to these megacaps.

the head of investment analysis and research at Hargreaves Lansdown suggested that further near-term gains for these stocks might be hard to come by and that booking profits now would let investors diversify their portfolios.

"Now is probably not [the time] to buy Apple or Tesla shares," she said.
Wall noted that both TSLA and AAPL belong to the S&P 500, meaning that exposure to that index through investments like ETFs can also provide exposure to those high-profile names.

As such, she advised investors to look their holdings in these stocks and use that as a benchmark of whether they need to broaden their portfolios to avoid becoming overly concentrated

https://seekingalpha.com/news/3785043-dont-get-overexposed-to-tesla-and-apple-investment-analyst
